meaning.example: combine work and play

phrases.phrase: 大阪の仕事を兼ねて京都見物に行く
translations: I am going to Osaka on business, I'll combine it with  a sightseeing visit to Kyoto.

phrases.phrase: 総理大臣（首相）と外務大臣（外相）とを兼ねる。
translations: Hold the office of Prime Minister concurrently with the portfolio of Foreign Minister.

phrases.phrase: 私は勉強と遊びを兼ねている仕事につきたい。
translations: I want to get a job that mixes  work and play.

translations: Combined with writing practice, I am corresponding with my Japanese pen friend. I guess I am killing two birds with one stone.

phrases.phrase: 趣味と実益を兼ねて日本語の勉強をしたが、いつの間にか、通訳が本業になってしまった。
translations: Along with personal interest and practical reasons, I studied Japanese. Before I knew it, translation became my main source of income.

meaning.example: he speaks vulcan, not to mention geek.

translations: We were served French champagne, not to mention  the usual cocktails.

phrases.phrase: ジェーンはギターは言うまでもなく、バイオリンもひける。

translations: Boston is too cold for me, let alone Chicago.

phrases.phrase: これらの言葉ですらいつか消えてしまいます。

translations: The bag indeed looks heavy, but there's nothing inside, so it only weighs 1 kilo.

phrases.phrase: あのスーツはいかにも高そうだ。

phrases.phrase: いかにもビルのやりそうなことだ。

meaning.meaning: in one's own way, one's own style

phrases.phrase: 「あら ごめんなさい。どうやら間違え電話をしてしまったようだね。」

phrases.phrase: どうやら、そのみすぼらしいアパートは空き家のようだ。

meaning.meaning: 1. started, but not finished; 2. nearly occurred (but didn't)

phrases.phrase: 作文は今日中に書かなければならないのにまだ書きかけだ。

translations: Birds' wings correspond to man's arms and hands.

translations: Do you know the French equivalent of the word?

meaning.example: due to the confusion

translations: As an infant, he underwent a stressful situation.

phrases.phrase: この核時代にあっては、世界中どこの国だって安全ではない。

phrases.phrase: その行いが神にあってなされたことが明らかにされるためである。」
translations: So that it may be seen plainly that what he has done has been done through God.

phrases.phrase: その宝はまだ森の中にあって、そこの木の下に埋めてある。

translations: That every one who believes in him may have eternal life.

meaning.meaning: Brings about an effect on; relates to; a matter of

phrases.phrase: これは我が校の名誉にかかわる問題だ。

phrases.phrase: それは生死にかかわる問題だ。

meaning.meaning: Without really planning to, ~ A phrase indicating that the subject does something without paying much attention or that when, where, to whom, etc. s.t. took place is unclear.

phrases.phrase: ゴロゴロしながら見るともなく外を見ると、アンパンマンがいました！

phrases.phrase: どこからともなく

meaning.meaning: leads to, all the way to, as far as

meaning.meaning: let alone B; not to mention; of course A but also B;

phrases.phrase: 彼は少ないながらも持ち合わせていた金を全部私にくれた。
translations: He gave me what little money he had about him.

phrases.phrase: 彼は少ないながらも彼の持ち物すべてを私にくれた。
translations: Notwithstanding the small amount he did have, he gave me all that he had

meaning.example: お金よりも健康が大切なことを言うまでもない It goes with out saying that health is more important than money

phrases.phrase: 電話ですむことですから、わざわざ行くまでもありません。
translations: This matter can be dealt with by telephone, so there's no need to go all the way there.

phrases.phrase: ただの風邪ですから、薬を飲むまでもありません。
translations: Its just a cold, so its not neccessary to take medicine

phrases.phrase: いろいろな意味で、正直が最善の策であることは言うまでもない。

phrases.phrase: お金がすべてではないのは言うまでもない。

phrases.phrase: お金よりも健康が大切なことは言うまでもない。

phrases.phrase: うっかり口を滑らせると思わぬ結果を招くことが多い。

phrases.phrase: 降りるところをうっかり通り越した。

phrases.phrase: ついうっかりしてバスを乗り間違えた。

meaning.meaning: since (A) started, it has been continuously in the same state
meaning.example: Use old things as they were originally used.

phrases.phrase: すべての人は生まれながらに平等である。
translations: All people are created equal by birth.

phrases.phrase: 彼は生まれながらに知性と美に恵まれていた。
translations: Nature endowed him with wit and beauty.

phrases.phrase: 彼は生まれながらにして偉大な才能に恵まれていた。
translations: He was endowed with great talents.

phrases.phrase: 昔ながらのやり方。
translations: In the traditional [unchanged of old] style.

phrases.phrase: 古いものを昔ながらに使う。
translations: Use old things as they were originally used.

meaning.meaning: unless / impossible if it's not / only possible with/by/at/etc / very difficult by any other~,

translations: Such a new conception is something only that designer could think of.

phrases.phrase: こんな美味しい料理は母親ならではのものです。

phrases.phrase: あの人ならではこのような文章を書けなかっただろう。
translations: No one could have written such a prose as this one except him.

phrases.phrase: あの人ならではとてもこの仕事はできない。
translations: Noone but he would be equal to this task.

phrases.phrase: その辞書ならではの特徴

meaning.example: anyway, you can't come

phrases.phrase: それはとにかくとして、この問題はどうするの。

phrases.phrase: とにかく私に言えるのは

phrases.phrase: とにかく頼むからちょっと聞いてよ

translations: Anyway, we won't know unless we try.

translations: In any case you should come up to Tokyo.

meaning.example: Just like the real thing.

phrases.phrase: さまざまなトラブルを想定した本番さながらの訓練

phrases.phrase: 本場ニューヨークさながらのジャズナイト

translations: How to light a fire just like they did it in the stone age.

translations: A stylish atmosphere like New York

point: もさることながら (も然る事乍ら)

translations: In America, Basketball is clearly popular but so is Football.

translations: In solving the problem of street-parking of cars the response of the council is obviously important but the attitude of the local residents is also a significant factor.

phrases.phrase: 両親の意向もさることながら、子供自身が有名校にあこがれている。
translations: Not only intention of the parents, the child himself has yearned to the famous school.

translations: This library's large collection of books is one thing, but the services they provide are really wonderful.

translations: As the population has aged, the care of senile seniors has become a problem. It is true that from now on care will be an important issue, but the question of how to prevent people from becoming senile is more important.

meaning.meaning: Although it is said that, even though it is said, admitting that, that being said, however, nevertheless

phrases.phrase: 便利とはいえパソコンは高いのでなかなか買えない。
translations: They're useful... but having said that, computers are so expensive that I can't buy one.

translations: Recently, my 80 year old grandmother fell on the stairs and hurt her leg, and now she has trouble walking. Having said that, it's not as if she cannot walk at all, in other words she can manage to do the housework without problems.

phrases.phrase: 相手に言い分もわかったとはいえ、心から納得したわけではない
translations: Admitting where he's coming from, I still can't really agree with him

phrases.phrase: 春になったとはいえ朝晩はまだ寒い。
translations: They say that Spring has arrived but the mornings and evenings are still cold.

phrases.phrase: 幼いとは言え、その子は自分の家庭の苦しい事情を理解している。

meaning.meaning: Used to express passive and active actions happening at once.
meaning.example: push and be pushed. go and come back, chase and be chased

phrases.phrase: ラシューアワーの車内で乗客は押しつ押されつしている
translations: in a rush-hour train, the passengers push and are pushed

phrases.phrase: 彼が通りを行きつ戻りつしているのが見えた
translations: I saw him walking up and down the street.

phrases.phrase: 遠くに見えつ隠れつする富士山
translations: Mt. Fuji appearing and disappearing in the distance

phrases.phrase: 彼と僕とは持ちつ持たれつだ
translations: He and I manage to get along (somehow) by supporting each other.

phrases.phrase: A社とは長年の付き合いで、持ちつ持たれつの関係にある。
translations: We have been working with A company for a long time, so we have a relationship based on give and take.

meaning.example: I barely made it to the train.

phrases.phrase: 走って行ったらかろうじて2時の電車に間に合いました
translations: I ran and barely made the 2 O'Clock train

phrases.phrase: かろうじて落第せずにすんだ
translations: I just barely managed to avoid dropping out of class

phrases.phrase: かろうじて付き合っている
translations: They are just barely still together

phrases.phrase: １１時までにかろうじてなんとかその手紙を書いた。
translations: I barely managed to finish the letter by eleven o'clock.

phrases.phrase: かろうじて間に合いましたね。
translations: You are only just in time.

meaning.meaning: No matter what; Even if; No matter how
meaning.example: Even the company president has to obey the rules.

phrases.phrase: 社長であれ規則はまもらないといけない。
translations: Even the company president has to obey the rules.

phrases.phrase: 投票は海外に住んでいる人であれするべきだ。
translations: Voting is something that you have to do, even if you live abroad.

phrases.phrase: あなたの職業がなんであれ、また、その職業にどんなに満足していても、何かほかの仕事を選べばよかったと思うときがあるものだ。

phrases.phrase: たとえ天候がどうであれ、私は行きます。
translations: I will go, be the weather what it may.

phrases.phrase: ドアの所にいる人が誰であれ、待つように言ってください。
translations: Whoever is at the door, please ask him to wait.

meaning.example: More than winning the match, i think we can be proud that we really gave it our all

phrases.phrase: トムはいまや以前にもまして勤勉に働いている。
translations: Tom works more diligently now.

phrases.phrase: 何ものにもまして私は健康になりたい。
translations: Above all, I want to be healthy.

phrases.phrase: 彼は以前にもまして勉強しようと決めたのです。
translations: He decided to study harder.

phrases.phrase: 彼は何物にもまして名誉を重んじる。
translations: He values honor above anything else.

phrases.phrase: その花は色が美しいのにもまして、香りが素晴らしい。
translations: This flower's color is wonderful. However, the scent is even more wonderful.

meaning.meaning: without (the thing "without" is s.t. that should naturally have been there)
meaning.example: You cannot enter university without the proper forms

phrases.phrase: あなたのおもてなしにはどんなに感謝しても感謝しきれません。
translations: Your hospitality cannot go unthanked.

phrases.phrase: この辞書なしには済まされない。
translations: I can't do without this dictionary.

phrases.phrase: その取り決めは、予告なしに変ることがある。
translations: The arrangements are subject to change without notice.

translations: I just said so without thinking much about it. I didn't mean anything serious.

meaning.meaning: in sharp contrast with; compared to

translations: In contrast to  my old car, his is really fast.

phrases.phrase: 同じ年の人にひきかえ彼はとても頭がいいです。

phrases.phrase: 几帳面な父にひきかえ息子はだらしなかった。

translations: While the quality of the education at this college is excellent, the quality of the campus facilities is inferior

meaning.example: noone but him can do this

phrases.phrase: こんなおいしい料理は母親でなくては作れない。

phrases.phrase: そうでなくては話にならない。

phrases.phrase: 君たち学生は勤勉でなくてはならない。
translations: You students are supposed to be diligent.

meaning.meaning: because (of a negative thing); simply because; simply on account of

meaning.example: Whatever happened

meaning.example: It's too late to say you're sorry!

meaning.example: She winked at me, as if to say , I love you

phrases.phrase: 義務兵役制度はひとり台湾、ドイツだけでなくデンマーク、オーストリアなど全世界20カ 国で長い歴史を持っています。

meaning.example: height of luxury

meaning.example: he won. After all, he is a fast runner

phrases.phrase: 一分たりとも無駄に出来ないぞ。

phrases.phrase: 彼は帰ってくるなり食事もせずに寝てしまいました。

phrases.phrase: 何も知らぬこととて、失礼を致しました。

meaning.example: Either you must come here or I must go there.

translations: It would have been better if you'd gone and asked the police or something instead of lingering around searching for it.

phrases.phrase: 今年こそは修士論文を書き上げてみせる。

phrases.phrase: 読んでみせる
translations: I'm going to read it, if you will.

phrases.phrase: どんな手を使ってでも勝ちとってみせる。

phrases.phrase: 私はどんな困難にも耐えてみせる。

phrases.phrase: 石にかじりついても成功してみせる。

meaning.meaning: it's already too late, It's no use doing s.t. now

phrases.phrase: 今さら説明したところで先生は許してくれないと思う。

phrases.phrase: 今さら騒いだところで、どうにもならないよ。後の祭りだよ。

meaning.example: the mail I received today

phrases.phrase: お返事をお待ちしております。またお返事をいただくことにより、私どもはより効率よく会議の準備をすることができます。
translations: Your response is greatly appreciated and will enable us to prepare more efficiently.

meaning.meaning: For the purpose of; To ____, In order to
meaning.example: I studied hard in order to become an engineer.

phrases.phrase: エンジニアになるべく一生懸命勉強した
translations: I studied hard in order to become an engineer.

phrases.phrase: このお支払いの問題が解決できるよう、ご指摘の件を改善すべく努力いたします。
translations: We will make great efforts in order to remedy the problem you indicated, so that we can solve this payment problem.

phrases.phrase: 彼らは男を逮捕すべく追いかけた。
translations: They chased the man to arrest him.

phrases.phrase: 恩師に会うべく、久しぶりに母校を訪れた
translations: For the first time in ages, I went back to my old school in order to see my old teacher.

phrases.phrase: 本学は、経済的な理由で大学教育を受けられない海外の優秀な学生にその機会を与えるべく、 奨学金を供与している。
translations: We provide scholarships to give educational opportunities to excellent students from overseas who cannot go on to higher education for financial reasons.

meaning.meaning: Once [things have] reached the point at which...; (Only) now that it has come to this...
meaning.example: Expresses that it is already late in the game. // in an extreme instance //at this moment [point] (in time)

phrases.phrase: 破産しそうで破産に至っていない人
translations: someone who is on the verge of bankruptcy but hasn't been through bankruptcy

phrases.phrase: 学生達も受験を目前にするに至って、やっとやる気になった。
translations: When the university students reached the stage of their exams, they finally got motivation.

phrases.phrase: いじめによる自殺が社会問題化するに至って、やっと文部省は重い腰を上げた。
translations: Suicide due to bullying has reached the level of being one of society’s problems. Therefore, finally the ministry of education has decided to act.

phrases.phrase: 大地震で何千人もの死傷者を出すに至って、やっと危機管理の重要性が叫ばれるようになった。
translations: It took thousands of earthquake casualties before the importance of crisis management could finally be called for.

phrases.phrase: 腹心の部下が辞めてしまうに至って、社長は自分の非に気づいた。
translations: It took his closest confident resigning before the company president awoke to his own fault.

meaning.example: the utmost joy

phrases.phrase: 赤面の至りだ。
translations: I was completely embarassed.

phrases.phrase: 若気の至りで
translations: in the folly of youth

phrases.phrase: 喜びの至り
translations: utmost joy

phrases.phrase: 冥加の至り
translations: great blessing

phrases.phrase: 憧れの女優に握手してもらって、もう感激の至りだ。
translations: I shook the hand of my favourite actress. I was completely overwhelmed.

meaning.meaning: Conveys the idea that if something occurs, then a bad end is reached.
meaning.example: If you tell your girlfriend that her cooking sucks, you're screwed.

phrases.phrase: 今までどんなに頑張ったには関係なく、あきらめたらそれまでだ。
translations: It doesn't matter how hard you've tried up this point. If you quit, it's all over.

phrases.phrase: 君がいやだと言えばそれまでだ。
translations: If you say no, there is an end of the matter.

phrases.phrase: 大審院で有罪になればそれまでだ。
translations: If the prisoner is found guilty in the Supreme Court, the decision is without appeal.

phrases.phrase: カンニングして問題を解いても、先生に見つかってしまったらそれまでだ。
translations: Even if you cheated and solved the problem, if you were caught by a teacher, it ends.

phrases.phrase: 成人指定映画は青少年の見るべからざるものだ。
translations: Movies for adults must not be watched by young people.

phrases.phrase: 許すべからざる行為。
translations: An act that cannot be forgiven.

phrases.phrase: これは将に無視すべからざる犯罪ではないでしょうか。
translations: Is it not true that this is certainly a crime that cannot be ignored?

phrases.phrase: 今日の社会では、パソコンは欠くべからざるものとなっている。
translations: In today's society, computers are becoming something you can't do without.

phrases.phrase: この荷物には「危険！触るべからず」と書いてある
translations: On this luggage, it is written/stated that 「Danger! Do not touch」

meaning.example: I can't help feeling sorry for them

phrases.phrase: 孤児には同情をきんじえない。
translations: I can’t help feeling sorry for the orphans.

phrases.phrase: 同情を禁じえない
translations: cant help feeling sorry for

phrases.phrase: 彼の愚かな振る舞いに怒りを禁じえなかった。
translations: I could not control my anger at his silly behaviour.

phrases.phrase: 不安を禁じえない。
translations: I can't help but be worried.

phrases.phrase: 彼は彼女に驚きを禁じえなかった。
translations: He couldn't help but surprise her.

meaning.meaning: Normally Its better to (You can never have too much)
meaning.example: (As used by my Tennis Club Chairman) It would be better if the weather was nice

phrases.phrase: 用心に越したことはないんですが．．
translations: You can never be too careful

phrases.phrase: この仕事は経験がなくてもかまわないが、もちろんあるに越したことは無い。
translations: This job doesn't require experience but it would probably be an advantage.

phrases.phrase: 明日、雨が降らないと言っても、傘を持つに越したことは無い。
translations: Even though they said it won't rain tomorrow, better to have your umbrella with you just in case.

phrases.phrase: 病気の時は寝るに越したことはない。
translations: When you are sick, sleeping is the best thing to do.

phrases.phrase: 日本語が話せるようになりたかったら、日本へ行くに越したことはないと思うけれど、まずアメリカでちゃんと勉強してから行った方がいいと思います。
translations: If you want to become proficient in Japanese, the best thing is to go to Japan, but I think you should first study properly [i.e. the basics] in America.

meaning.meaning: "thought so, but" OR, "would have thought so/imagined, but didn't"
meaning.example: I thought this restaurant would be cheap but (surprisingly) the bill was over 5,000 yen.

phrases.phrase: 昼間だから絶対込んでいると思いきや、一人もいなかった。
translations: Despite having thought that it must be crowded since it was afternoon, (surprisingly) not a single person was there

phrases.phrase: このレストランは安いと思いきや、会計は5千円以上だった！
translations: I thought this restaurant would be cheap but (surprisingly) the bill was over 5,000 yen!

phrases.phrase: 雪国で育った彼のことだから、さぞかしスキーがうまいだろうと思いきや、滑っては転び、滑っては転びの繰り返しだった
translations: For someone brought up in a snowy country, you'd think he'd be great at skiing, but he just slips and falls, slips and falls.

phrases.phrase: 老後は退職金の蓄えで安泰だと思いきや、インフレで預金が目減りしてしまった。
translations: In my remaining years I thought I could live in peace and security from the stores of my retirement savings, but to my surprise , inflation has diminished the value of my savings.

phrases.phrase: A チームの勝利で試合終了かと思いきや、最後に大逆転が起こった。
translations: I thought that maybe the tournament would end with a win for team A, but surprisingly, it ended in a huge turn in the opposite direction.

point: ~としたところで, ~としたって, ~にしたところで

meaning.example: Even if all the members participated, there'd still only be about 20 persons

phrases.phrase: 全員が参加するとしたところで、せいぜい２０人位だ.
translations: Even if all the members participated, there'd still only be about 20 persons

phrases.phrase: 彼は日本語を20年も勉強しているが、その彼にしたところで、まだ分からない文法に時々出くわすそうだ。
translations: He has studied Japanese for 20 years, but he told me that even he enccounters grammar he doesn't understand.

phrases.phrase: 三島由紀夫は産湯に浸かった記憶があると書いているが、彼にしたところで、死ぬまでのすべての記憶がある訳ではない。
translations: Yukio Mishima wrote that he remembered taking his first bath as a baby, but there's no way even he remembered everything he did from birth until death.

phrases.phrase: 彼がどんなに歌が得意としたって、素人の域を出ていないよ。
translations: However good his singing is, the fact is he hasn't left the realms of an amateur.

phrases.phrase: わたしにしたって、その問題については、どうしたりいかわからにんです。
translations: Even I don't know what the right thing to do is when it comes to that problem

meaning.example: The old man still cherishes his old pen.

phrases.phrase: 御爺さんは未だに古いペンを愛用している。
translations: The old man still cherishes his old pen.

phrases.phrase: 彼女は未だに帰宅していない。
translations: She has not come home yet.

phrases.phrase: その祖父が買った時計は未だに調子がいいです。
translations: That watch my grandfather bought is still in good condition.

phrases.phrase: その文化人類学者は「その州では未だに古い習慣が根強い。」だと言いました。
translations: That anthropoligst said the old customs are still long standing in that province.

phrases.phrase: その傷は未だに治らない。
translations: The wound is still not healed.

meaning.example: Even though I live in Tokyo, there are many sightseeing spots in the city that I don't know.

phrases.phrase: 近年、医学が目覚ましく進歩したといえども、病人の数は減少傾向にはない
translations: in recent years, even though you could say medical science has been progressing greatly, the number of sick people has not decreased

phrases.phrase: いかに多忙といえども、健康管理を怠ってはならない
translations: Even though you might be so busy, you must not neglect your health

phrases.phrase: たとえ外国人といえども「郷に入って、郷に従え」です。
translations: Even though he is a foreigner, it's a case of when in Rome, do as the Romans do.

phrases.phrase: 老いたりといえども、まだまだ若いものには負けないつもりだ。
translations: Even though I am getting on a bit, I don't intend to lose out to the youngsters for some time to come.

phrases.phrase: いかに日本での生活が長いといえども、言葉の問題には常に遭遇する。
translations: Although I've lived in Japan for a long time, I constantly encounter language problems

point: (よ)うが, (よ)うと　ようが　ようと

meaning.meaning: "even if", "no matter what" (people say etc.), strong expression that contains the idea of concession
meaning.example: Even if people say I'm stubborn or stupid, I'll do what I believe.

phrases.phrase: 人がなんと言おう（と/が）、私は自分の子供を信じている。
translations: Whatever other people say, I believe my child

phrases.phrase: 頑固と言われよう（と／が）バカと言われよう（と／が）、私は自分の信じることをやります。
translations: Even if people say I'm stubborn or stupid, I'll do what I believe in.

phrases.phrase: あの教授は学生が分かろう（と／が）分かるまい（と／が）かまわず授業を進めていく。
translations: That professor keeps lecturing regardlesss of whether his students understand it or not.

phrases.phrase: 報酬が多かろう（と／が）少なかろう（と／が）私はやるべきことをやるだけだ。
translations: Whether the compensation is high or low, I'll just do what I have to do.

phrases.phrase: 周囲に反対されようが、自分でやると決めた以上は最後までやり抜くつもりだ
translations: even if those around me disagree, once I've decided I'll do it, I'll give it my all

meaning.meaning: even though ~ try / want to ~; although ~ be thinking of doing; A conjunctive phrase that indicates concession: "even though s.o. tries to do s.t., he/she cannot do it for some reason"
meaning.example: I have a terrible headache, and I cannot get up even though I want to

phrases.phrase: 頭が痛くて、起きようにも起きられなかった
translations: I have a terrible headache, and I cannot get up even though I want to

phrases.phrase: 新しいパソコンを買おうにも、お金がなくて買えない。
translations: Even though I want to buy a new computer, I don't have the money so I can't.

phrases.phrase: 会社を辞めようにも、次の仕事が見つからない。
translations: Even though I think of quitting the company, I can't find another job so I can't.

phrases.phrase: 寿司を作ろうにも材料が手に入らない。
translations: Even though I want to make sushi, I cannot get the ingredients

phrases.phrase: 母は僕の日本人のガールフレンドと話そうにも日本語ができなかった。
translations: Even though my mother wanted to talk to my Japanese girlfriend, my mother couldn't because she can't speak Japanese.

meaning.meaning: as if; as if ~ were convinced that; as if ~ believed that; as if ~ decided that
meaning.example: Takemoto vented his long held complaints as if he were convinced this was the time to do so

phrases.phrase: 課長は余計な質問はするなとばかりに私ににらみつけた。
translations: My section chief glared at me as if to tell me not to ask any unnecessary questions.

phrases.phrase: 霧が晴れたので私がチャンスとばかりに写真を撮りまくった。
translations: The fog had cleared, so I took pictures furiously, as if it were my only chance.

phrases.phrase: 竹本はこの時とばかりに日頃の不満を吐き出した。
translations: Takemoto vented his long-held complaints as if he were convinced this was the time to do so.

phrases.phrase: 彼女が舞台に登場すると、「待ってました！」とばかりに大きな拍手が起こった
translations: she appeared on the stage, and as if everyone had been waiting, huge applause broke out

phrases.phrase: 彼女は、信じられないとばかりに、口を開けたまま彼を見つめていた。
translations: She just stared at him with her mouth wide open as if she didn't believe him.

meaning.example: In order to pass the test, he studied day and night.

phrases.phrase: キリスト教義の正当性をより強固にせんがための伏線ととれないこともありません。
translations: This must be a covert effort in order to further strengthen the veracity of the Christian dogma

phrases.phrase: あの頃わたしは大学に進学せんがために毎日必死でがんばった。
translations: At that time, in order to go on to university I frantically did my best everyday.

phrases.phrase: 研究を完成せんがため、彼は昼夜寝ずにがんばった。
translations: In order to finish the project, he worked day and night without sleeping. sengatame

phrases.phrase: 一日も早く自分の店を持たんがために、必死で働いている。
translations: To keep one's store going even one more day, one is frantically working.

meaning.example: Looking back on it now, breaking up was the right thing to do.

phrases.phrase: 今から思えばあの時に会社を辞めたことは間違いではなかった。
translations: Looking back on it now, quitting the company was the right thing to do.

phrases.phrase: 今から思えば両親に言われた通りにしておけば良かった。
translations: Looking back on it now I wish i had done things the way my parents told me.

phrases.phrase: 今から思えばまだ両親に手伝うことをしなかった。
translations: Looking back on it now I haven't done anything to help my parents.

phrases.phrase: 今から思えば父が私にしつけを教えてもらったのが良かった。
translations: Looking back now I think it's good that my father teaches discipline .

meaning.example: If it rains any more...

phrases.phrase: これ以上雨が降れば、川が氾濫してしまう
translations: If it rains any more than this the river will flood.

phrases.phrase: 皆さんからお褒めの言葉を頂きこれ以上の光栄はございません。
translations: Having received many kind compliments from all of you, I cannot feel any more honored than this.

phrases.phrase: これ以上待つのは時間の浪費だ。
translations: It's a waste of time to wait any longer.

phrases.phrase: これ以上何を失えば心は許されるの
translations: How much more do I have to lose, before my heart is forgiven? (from "one more time, one more chance" by yamasaki masayoshi)

phrases.phrase: 理由のいかんによらず、殺人は許されないことだ。
translations: Regardless of the reason, murder is unforgiveable

phrases.phrase: 国籍のいかんを問わず、採用試験を受けることのできる自治体が増えている。
translations: The number of municipalities where one can take the employment test regardless of nationalty is increasing.

phrases.phrase: 納入した学費は理由のいかんに関わらず返却しません。
translations: The tuition and fees you have paid will not be returned, no matter what the reason.

phrases.phrase: このコンテンツの複製は方法、媒体のいかんを問わず禁止されている。
translations: Copying the content is prohibited, regardless of the method or the medium.

meaning.example: Making progress in one's work

phrases.phrase: 仕事がはかどってるようですね
translations: Looks like you are making progress in your work.

phrases.phrase: どの程度はかどっているのですか？
translations: How much progress are you making?

phrases.phrase: あの人は学校の勉強のほうははかどっているのですか。
translations: How is getting along with his school work?

phrases.phrase: 仕事は非常にはかどっている。
translations: The work is marching right along.

meaning.meaning: has value; it is worth doing
meaning.example: It is worth reading that book

phrases.phrase: 十分読むにたえる作品だ。
translations: That book is worth reading

phrases.phrase: 趣味で始めた焼き物だが、ようやく市販するにたえる作品ができるようになった
translations: I just started pottery as a hobby, but pretty soon I was making stuff that was good enough for sale

phrases.phrase: あの子は大人の鑑賞にたえる絵を描く
translations: That kid draws pictures that are worthy of adult appreciation.

phrases.phrase: ずいぶん値段が安いけど、使用にたえるかどうか、ちゃんと確認して買った方がいい。
translations: The price may be very cheap, but before you buy it you should make sure to check whether it merits use or not.

meaning.meaning: No matter what; Even if; No matter how
meaning.example: no matter what kind of person

phrases.phrase: どんな人であろうと、この映画は楽しめます。
translations: This movie can be enjoyed by anyone, no matter what kind of person they are.

phrases.phrase: いかに粗末であろうとも、我が家は我が家である。
translations: No matter how humble it may be, home is home.

phrases.phrase: この本を書いたのが誰であろうとも、その人はとても利口だ。
translations: No matter who it was that wrote this book, he's very clever.

phrases.phrase: どんな仕事であろうと、圧迫されるときはある。
translations: In every job, there are times when you feel pressure.

meaning.example: Unfortunately, it came to the point where he had to borrow money.

phrases.phrase: あの二人は犬猿の仲で、ちょっとしたことでも、すぐ口論になる始末だ。
translations: Those two don't get along very well. Unfortunately , at the drop of a hat, they start arguing.

phrases.phrase: 友達に借金までするしまつだ。
translations: Unfortunately, it has got to the point where he has to borrow money from friends.

phrases.phrase: この始末は、今まで述べたとおりです。
translations: Just as I said, it turned out like this!

phrases.phrase: 離婚したうえに、首にまでなるしまつだ。
translations: On top of getting divorced, I got fired from my job

meaning.example: I kept standing for 5 hours.

phrases.phrase: 新幹線の中では、東京から青森まで３時間立ちっぱなしだった。足が痛くなっちゃった！
translations: On the shinkansen from Toukyou to Aomori I kept standing up for 3 hours. My feet hurt!

phrases.phrase: ここに置きっぱなしにしちゃダメでしょ。
translations: Hey, you can't leave your things here.

phrases.phrase: ゴミを散らかしっぱなしにしないでね。
translations: Don't drop your rubbish about, ok.

phrases.phrase: 友達のビデオが借りっぱなしだ。早く返さなくちゃ。
translations: I borrowed my friends video and didn't return it. I'd better return it soon.

meaning.meaning: Without consideration for... / Despite... / Without thinking...
meaning.example: Without considering his parents expectations, he dropped out of university.

phrases.phrase: 彼は大学入試をよそに、毎日パソコンに興じてる。
translations: Despite having university entrance exams soon, he's wasting his time on the computer every day.

phrases.phrase: 親の心配をよそに遊んでばかりいる。
translations: Without considering that his parents might be worried, he always slacks off.

phrases.phrase: 中国人の反対の声をよそに、小泉総理は靖国神社に参拝してしまいました。
translations: Indifferent to the protests from China, Mr Koizumi visited Yasukuni Shrine.

phrases.phrase: 首相は国民の批判をよそにイラク戦争支持を楓ｾした。
translations: ​ Ignoring the people's criticism, the prime minister declared his support for the Iraq War.

meaning.meaning: would be much better, would be acceptable
meaning.example: If it was next month that would be better, but it isn't going to happen until next year.

phrases.phrase: 一度ならまだしもここまで六回その言葉を間違えて書いた。
translations: Once would be acceptable, but you've misspelled that word six times now.

phrases.phrase: この方がまだしもあれよりよい。
translations: This would be better than that.

phrases.phrase: こんなひどい目に合うよりまだしも死んだほうがよい。
translations: I would rather die than have such a terrible experience.

phrases.phrase: すうじつならまだしも１０日も滞納している。
translations: A few days would have been excusable but you are in arrears for 10 days.

meaning.meaning: While 〜 To take advantage of a moment of time to do something　(there is an element of cunning in its meaning)
meaning.example: (1)kare ga ｙudan shiteiru suki ni kishuu shite hoshin da zo. The best thing to do is to attack him when his guard is down.

phrases.phrase: 皆さん、ジョンさんがいないすきに、サプライズパーティーを整えましょう。
translations: Lets prepare the surprise party for John in his absence.

phrases.phrase: 皆が前を向いているすきにぎゅっと手を引いてほしいんだ。
translations: I want you to take me by the hand while everyone else is looking the other way.

phrases.phrase: 先生が余所見をしているすきに、ラブレターをきみが渡してくれたんだな。
translations: While the teacher's attention was momentarily distracted you passed me a love letter didn't you.

phrases.phrase: 彼女が気がついていないすきに、彼女にキスした。
translations: While  she didn't pay attention, I kissed her

meaning.meaning: To add to, something alone is normally enough
meaning.example: This neighbourhood was already noisy enough but this week they started construction work

phrases.phrase: もうこの近所はただでさえうるさいところが、今週は近くで工事が始まったため、夜は一睡も出来なくなった。
translations: This neighbourhood is already normally noisy enough but this week construction started nearby so now I can hardly get a wink of sleep.

phrases.phrase: もうただでさえ迷惑をかけているのに〜
translations: Haven't you caused enough trouble already?

phrases.phrase: これはただでさえおいしいものが、さらに我が隠し味を入れたら美味しくてたまらなくなるよ。
translations: This is normally really delicious anyway but if you add our special ingredient it will be irresistable.

phrases.phrase: 今日はただでさえ忙しいのに、母に買い物に行かされた
translations: To day, I'm already busy enough but ,my mother wanted me to go shopping

meaning.meaning: Because ~; ~ as expected; because ~, naturally ~; Introduces an expected reason for some circumstance that is different from the usual situation.
meaning.example: Because this is the series of holidays after the bonus season, (unsurprisingly), all the tourist spots are crowded.

phrases.phrase: ボーナス後の連休とあって、観光地はどこも人でいっぱいだ。
translations: Because this is the series of holidays after the bonus season, unsurprisingly, all the tourist spots are crowded.

phrases.phrase: 夏休みが始まったとあって、子供たちはみんな嬉しそうだ。
translations: Summer vacation has begun, so the children all look happy.

phrases.phrase: 人気スターがやって来るとあって、空港は大勢の人たちが待ち受けていた
translations: because a popular star is coming, a large crowd gathered to meet him at the airport

phrases.phrase: 掃除が終わったらお菓子がもらえるとあって、子供たちは一生懸命手伝っている。
translations: Because they know they'll get sweets after they finish cleaning, the children are doing their very best to help out.

meaning.example: In many countries, water and air polution is coupled with progressive environmental destruction

phrases.phrase: 多くの国々では、水や空気の汚染と相まって、環境破壊が進んでいる
translations: In many countries, water and air polution is coupled with progressive environmental destruction

phrases.phrase: 実力と運とが相まって、彼を成功に導いた。
translations: His ability coupled with luck brought about his success.

phrases.phrase: そのゲームはかわいいキャラクターと魅力的なストーリーがあいまって、多くのユーザーに支持されたヒット作品となった。
translations: That game featured cute characters coupled with a charming story, so it became a big hit supported by many users.

phrases.phrase: コーチの指導力と選手のやる気が相まって、優勝できた。
translations: The coach's leadership abilities coupled with the player's motivation lead to the victory

meaning.meaning: expressing the speaker's feeling that although an ideal action or state isn't possible, at least the next best action or stat is or should be available
meaning.example: Although you may not be able to call this public performance a great success, it produced results of a sort.

phrases.phrase: この公演は大成功とは言えないまでも、それなりの成果をもたらした。
translations: Although you may not be able to call this public performance a great success, it produced results of a sort.

phrases.phrase: 彼の論文は決して多くないまでも、その質は非常に高い。
translations: Although he hasn't published many papers at all, the quality of those he has published is extremely high.

phrases.phrase: 彼が犯人だと断定できないまでも、いろいろと怪しいところがある
translations: Even though we can't conclude he's the culprit, he has many suspicious points

phrases.phrase: この彫刻は完璧とは言えないまでも、非常に可能性を感じさせる作品だった。
translations: The sculpture may not be called a perfect work, but it is a work that makes you feel there is much potential.

meaning.meaning: In terms of both ~ and ~; in terms of ~ as well as ~; from the perspective of both ~ and ~
meaning.example: From the perspective of the colour as well as the design, this suit is a good match for you

phrases.phrase: このスーツ、色といいデザインといい、お客様にはよく似合いですよ
translations: From the perspective of the colour as well as the design, this suit is a good match for you

phrases.phrase: 内容といい話し方といい、見事なスピーチでした。
translations: It was a splendid speech in terms of content as well as delivery.

phrases.phrase: 家柄といい学歴といい、彼は非の打ちどころがない。
translations: He is just perfect, both in terms of his family and educational background.

phrases.phrase: スピードといいパワーといい、今の彼に勝てる選手はいない。
translations: No player can beat him now in terms of either speed or power.

point: (よ)うと〜まい, (よ)うが〜まい, ようと〜まい, よう

meaning.example: Regardless of whether it rains or not, I'm going out.

phrases.phrase: 雨が降ろうが降るまいが、私は出かけます
translations: Regardless of whether it rains or not , I'm going out

phrases.phrase: パーティに参加しようがするまいが、会費は全員払わなければならない。
translations: Regardless of whether or not you go to the parties, all members must pay the membership fees.

phrases.phrase: 昔の恋人が結婚しようとしまいと、今の私に関係ないことです。
translations: Whether my childhood sweetheart gets married or not, it's got nothing to do with me now.

phrases.phrase: あの教授は学生がわかろうと分かるまいとかまわず授業を進めて行く
translations: That professor keeps lecturing, regardless of whether his students understand it or not.

meaning.meaning: By means of, via, through - method by which you do / achieve something
meaning.example: Inform by letter

phrases.phrase: 彼は人一倍の努力をもって優勝カップを手にすることができた
translations: with his amazing efforts, we were able to get the champion's cup

phrases.phrase: こんな難問は、優秀な彼の頭脳をもってしても解決できないだろう。
translations: Even with his brilliant mind, such a difficult problem cannot be resolved.

phrases.phrase: 身をもってその仕事の大変さを知った
translations: I learned [from experience / firsthand] how hard the work was.

phrases.phrase: 彼の迫ﾍをもってすれば，この問題の解決は容易であろう
translations: With his ability, he should be able to solve the problem easily.

meaning.example: People complain that Japanese is difficult but do not study enough.

phrases.phrase: ろくに彼女と話をする暇もない.
translations: I have hardly enough time to talk [have a chat] with her.

phrases.phrase: 彼女はろくに食べないで席を立った。
translations: She had only eaten a little before she left the table.

phrases.phrase: 多くの女性は自分の名前もろくに書けなかった。
translations: Many women could barely spell their names.

phrases.phrase: 昨夜はろくに眠れなかった。
translations: I could not sleep much last night.

phrases.phrase: あたかも永遠を傷つけることがないかのごとく暇をつぶしているが・・・。
translations: As if you could kill time without injuring eternity.

phrases.phrase: 誰も見ていないかのごとく自由に踊りましょう
translations: Dance freely as if nobody was watching.

phrases.phrase: その森の中は、何万年も前に戻ったかのごとく神秘的だった
translations: Within this forest, it was so mysterious as if one had even gone some ten thousands years back in time

meaning.example: as well not to buy them

phrases.phrase: サッカーで日本が勝って、韓国人の金さんがどんな気持ちかなんて、そんなこと、言わずもがなのことだよ。
translations: When Japan wins at football (soccer), you don't even need to ask to know how the Korean Mr. Kim feels.

phrases.phrase: 新しい電気製品なんて、買わずもがなで、買うとろくなものがない。
translations: You might as well not buy those new electronic gadgets. If you do then nothing good will come of it.

phrases.phrase: あの人の書く文章には無くもがなといえる言葉が多い。
translations: In his writings, there are a number of words which might better have been left out.

point: やまない (止ま無い・已ま無い)

meaning.example: Kids don't stop seeking their parents' love.

phrases.phrase: 子供たちは親の愛を求めてやまない。
translations: Kids don't stop seeking their parent's love.

phrases.phrase: 空模様からすると、雨はしばらくはやまないだろう。
translations: From the look of the sky I'm afraid the rain won't let up for a while.

phrases.phrase: ご健康を心から願ってやみません。
translations: I (never stop) wish you good health.

meaning.meaning: at the same time, incidentally；doing something while fulfilling different purposes at the same time

phrases.phrase: 仕事かたがた京都見物にゆく
translations: While on business, go sightseeing in Kyoto

phrases.phrase: 来春結婚する孫が、結婚の報告かたがた婚約者を連れてやってきた。
translations: My grandson, who is getting married next spring, has brought his fiancee with him to visit while bringing us news of his wedding.

phrases.phrase: 無事に卒業できたので、恩師に報告かたがた、手紙を書いた.
translations: She was able to graduate without any problems and so wrote a letter to thank her professor.

meaning.example: no need to feel sorry for him

phrases.phrase: それは驚くに当たらない。
translations: It is not to be wondered at.

phrases.phrase: 同情するにあたらない、飲酒運転したんだから、自業自得だ
translations: no need to feel sorry for him, he was drunk-driving so its his own fault.

phrases.phrase: 天気藍ﾍめったにあたらない。

phrases.phrase: 許すまじきことであれ。
translations: It's something that cannot be forgiven

phrases.phrase: すまじきものは宮仕え。
translations: It's government service one should avoid.

phrases.phrase: 許すまじき暴言を吐いた。
translations: She used offensive language that cannot be forgiven.

meaning.meaning: If thats not ... I don't know what is

phrases.phrase: このケーキが世界一でなくてなんだろう。

phrases.phrase: あの国の大統領は国民の意見は無視して何でも自分一人で決定する。これが独裁者でなくてなんだろう。
translations: The president of that country decides everything himself ignoring nation's concerns. If that's not dictatorship, then i don't know what is.

phrases.phrase: 自分の命を犠牲にして多くの人を救ったあの男が英雄でなくてなんだろう。
translations: That man who sacrificed his own life to help so many people, if he isn't a hero I don't know who is. でなくてなんだろう

meaning.example: Since then, I haven't seen Spike.

phrases.phrase: 僕はそれっきりスパイクと会っていない
translations: Since then, I haven't seen Spike.

phrases.phrase: 店はたたれたまま、それっきりだった。

phrases.phrase: 去年１１月プネに移りました。それっきり先生と連絡しなかったです。
translations: I shiefted to pune in november last year. After that I have not communicated with my teacher.

meaning.example: his sarcastic-ish way of speaking

phrases.phrase: 社長の皮肉めいた言い方を、社員は不快に感じている
translations: because of the President's sarcastic like way of speech, the employees felt uncomfortable.

phrases.phrase: きらめく太陽に青い海、考えだけでも胸がときめくわ。
translations: The glisten ing sun on the blue sea...Ahhh, just thinking about it makes my heart beat fast.

meaning.example: today's business will close at 7

phrases.phrase: 本日の営業は午後7時をもって終了いたします。
translations: The store will close today at seven o'clock.

phrases.phrase: これをもちまして本日の披露宴をめでたくお開きとあさせていただきます。

meaning.meaning: there is a tendency for ~ to happen (and it is somewhat bad and/or a cause for concern)

phrases.phrase: 人は自分の聞きたくないことは耳に入れないというきらいがあるのではないか。
translations: It seems people have a tendency not to listen to things they dont want to hear, right?

phrases.phrase: 彼女は優しいですが、知らずに人を傷付けることを言うきらいがある。
translations: She is a nice person; however, she tends to say hurtful things unintentionally.

phrases.phrase: 人間は年をとると、ほかの人の話しを聞かなくなるきらいがある。
translations: As humans get on in years, they tend to not listen to what others say.

meaning.meaning: I'm not sure if it is [possible/so] but...
meaning.example: It's possible that an expert could do this but there is no way I can do it.

phrases.phrase: 辞書があるならいざ知らず、何もなくてはこの文章はとても読めるものではない。
translations: Maybe it would be possible if I had a dictionary, but with nothing, it is by no means easy to read.

phrases.phrase: 専門家ならいざ知らず、素人ではこの化学品を作ることができない。
translations: Maybe it's possible for an expert, but a beginner can't make this chemical.

phrases.phrase: 他の人ならいざしらず、私はそんなことができない。

meaning.meaning: with 〜, some continuing activity will end (or a prohibition on an activity will start)
meaning.example: Starting today, I've decided to stop smoking.

phrases.phrase: 今日を限りに、この学校ともお別れです。

translations: That film was pulled just 15 days after it was first shown.

phrases.phrase: 人事部の山田さんは、明日を限りに退職します。
translations: Mr. Yamada from personnel will quit this job as of tomorrow.

meaning.meaning: "if it happens to be" • since it is a special condition
meaning.example: If you happen to have a large body and strong legs, you are the ideal shape for a rugby player

phrases.phrase: だれも行かないとあれば、わたしが行くしかないだろう。
translations: if it is so that no one goes, then there is nothing for it but for me to go

translations: If my girlfriend's parents happen to come to stay, I must make the apartment clean

phrases.phrase: プロともなると体つきが変わってくるというが、目の前の彼女のきゃしゃで凛とした立ち姿からは、とても激しいダンスを一人で踊り通す人のようには見えない。
translations: When you become a professional dancer, certain characteristics appear on your body, but looking at Kimura with her slim upright figure, she doesn't look like the vigorous dancing type.

phrases.phrase: 大学へ進学するともなると、学問、バイト、サークルなど、人それぞれのライフスタイルができてくる。
translations: When you enter college, each of you will develop your own lifestyle, with studies, work and club activities.

phrases.phrase: 桜の季節ともなると、この公園は花見客でにぎわう

meaning.meaning: In examples such as "Without A, I can't do B" where, without Action A, there is no possibility of B

phrases.phrase: 良いお返事をいただくことなしに、帰るわけにはまいりません

translations: Without the permission of the teacher in charge, you may not change your registered classes.

phrases.phrase: 外相は「真の相互理解に基づく関係は、領土問題を解決して平和条約を締結することなしには構築し得ない」
translations: The foreign minister said "a relationship built on genuine mutual understanding means that without solving the territorial dispute and completing the peace treaty, we cannot secure construction works"

meaning.meaning: "It's not as if" giving a reason why something should not be how it is

phrases.phrase: こどもではあるまいし、暗い所が怖いなんて、おかしいですね。

phrases.phrase: 幽霊が現れたんじゃあるまいし、そんな驚いた顔をするなよ。
translations: It's not like a ghost jumped out at you, quit giving me such a startled face.

meaning.example: She also has many worries due to her good looks.

phrases.phrase: 動かぬ証拠があるゆえに、有罪が確定した
translations: because of the rock-solid evidence, his guilt was proven

phrases.phrase: 彼女はその美貌の故に、悩みも多い。
translations: Because of her good looks, she also has many things to worry about.

phrases.phrase: 結果にこだわりすぎるがゆえに、小さなことに心を奪われることになる。
translations: Because you want the end result to be perfect, you end up being distracted by the little things,

meaning.meaning: despite a certain time / despite a certain situation

phrases.phrase: お忙しいところをおいで下さいまして、ありがとうございます。
translations: Thank you so much for coming, despite being so busy.

phrases.phrase: 本日は、雨で足元が大変悪いところを、このようにたくさんの方にご参加いただきまして、誠にありがとうございます。
translations: We are very thankful that so many people could participate even though it's so terrible underfoot, due to the rain.

phrases.phrase: お休みのところをお邪魔致しまして、申し訳ありません。
translations: I deeply apologise for intruding on you despite it being your holiday.

meaning.meaning: Not only ~ (but also ~); not only that. Used in comparison, juxtaposition, and analogy - literary language. Formal, written.
meaning.example: I heard that she didn't just look after the the elderly man who'd fallen over, she took him all the way home

phrases.phrase: 富士山はただ高いのみならず、姿も美しいので、日本の象徴として愛されている。
translations: Mount Fuji is not just a high mountain, it has a beautiful shape so it is loved as a symbol of Japan.

phrases.phrase: 彼はただ勇敢であるのみならず、優しい心の持ち主である。
translations: He is not only brave, but the owner of a kind heart.

phrases.phrase: これからの企業は単に利益を追求するのみならず、環境に配慮した生産活動を行わなければならない。
translations: Today's companies should not just pursue profits; they should also consider envrionmental protection issues in their production activities.

meaning.meaning: Emphasizing a strong emotional reaction either good or bad
meaning.example: I'm absolutely furious about the way he treats me.

phrases.phrase: 色々お世話になりまして、感謝にたえません
translations: you've been so good to me, I really want to thank you

phrases.phrase: 氏の当会へのご援助はまことに感謝にたえません
translations: We cannot be too grateful to him for the help he has given our society.

phrases.phrase: 彼の私に対する態度は憤慨に堪えない
translations: I'm absolutely furious about the way he treats me.

meaning.example: It's not a proper action for a professional artist to steal others compositions.

phrases.phrase: 人のお金を盗むとは、警察官にあるまじき行為だ。
translations: Stealing someone's money is not proper conduct for a police officer.

phrases.phrase: 他人の文章を盗んで書くとは、プロの作家にあるまじき行為だ。
translations: It's not proper behavior for a professional author to steal other people's writings.

phrases.phrase: その言葉は市長にあるまじきものであった。
translations: That remark was unworthy of a mayor.

meaning.meaning: not hard to ...(名詞＋にかたくない/　Vる＋にかたくない）
meaning.example: not hard to imagine it becoming a problem

phrases.phrase: 彼の不安は想像にかたくない
translations: Its not hard to imagine he is worried

phrases.phrase: 彼の喜びは、察するにかたくない。
translations: It's not hard to guess how happy he is.

meaning.example: he kept staring at her

phrases.phrase: 会社を出たなり、いつまでも帰らない。
translations: He left the office and hasn't come back.

phrases.phrase: 彼女を見つめたなり、しばらくの間微動だにしなかった。
translations: He stared at her and didn't move an inch for a while.

meaning.meaning: I'm not sure if it is [possible/so] but...
meaning.example: It's possible that an expert could do this, but I can't.

phrases.phrase: 君ならともかく、俺はそんなことをしない。
translations: Maybe you can do it, but I don't do such a thing.

phrases.phrase: 外人ならともかく、日本人はそんなことは絶対にしない。
translations: Maybe it's possible for a foreigner, but Japanese people would never do that.

meaning.meaning: it is even more unlikely that 〜
meaning.example: even adults also being eluded of this matter,there is no way/it is even more unlikely that children knows such a thing

phrases.phrase: 大人でさえ知らない事は、まして子供は知っているはずがない。
translations: It is even more unlikely/it is impossible for children to know things that even adults don't know.

phrases.phrase: 大人でさえ知らないし、まして子供は知っているはずがない。
translations: Even adutls also have no idea about it, it is even more unlikely for/it is impossible for/let alone of children to know about it.

point: 〜てはいられない・〜てばかりはいられない

meaning.example: we can't be relaxing like this drinking tea

phrases.phrase: もうすぐ試験なので、遊んでばかりはいられないのです。
translations: Because exam is just around the corner, I can't (afford to) be fooling around.

phrases.phrase: お客様がそろそろお着きになって大変なので、のんびりお茶など飲んではいられない
translations: Since the customers will be coming in no time and it will be a hard time, we can't just relaxing around drinking tea.

point: 不調法 or 無調法

meaning.example: (1)ainiku osake ha buchouhou deshite - I must apologize but I don't drink (2) karaoke wo utatte agerareru to ii n desuga, ainiku buchouhou na mono desu.　If I could sing karaoke to you I would but sorry unfortunately I can't.

phrases.phrase: 「一杯如何？」「ごめんね。まったく不調法なの」
translations: How about another ? sorry I cant cope with alcohol at all

phrases.phrase: 口は不調法だが、腕は確かだ
translations: I am not well spoken but can do a great job

point: やむをえない (已むを得無い)

meaning.meaning: no other way to do something　しかたがない
meaning.example: この大雪では、試合を中止にするのもやむをえない There's no other way but to cancel the game because of the snowfall

phrases.phrase: やむを得ず雨天で試合が中止になる場合はある。
translations: regretfully there may be situations where the game has to be cancelled due to bad weather.

phrases.phrase: やむを得ず雨天で試合が中止になる場合はある。
translations: regretfully there may be situations where the game has to be cancelled due to bad weather.

meaning.example: The child messes up [the room] (repeatedly) as soon as I clean so I already became wanting to give up.

phrases.phrase: 子供が掃除するそばから散らかすから、もうあきらめたくなった。
translations: The child messes it up as soon as  I clean, so I've gotten to the point of not wanting to even try anymore.

phrases.phrase: 私は聞いたそばから人の名前を忘れてしまう。
translations: I forget the person's name as soon as I hear it.

meaning.example: Ever since the daughter returned, her aging father has really perked up

usages: Verb て-form+からというもの

phrases.phrase: 娘が帰って来てからというもの、年老いた父親を見違えるほど元気になった
translations: Ever since the daughter returned, her aging father has really perked up

phrases.phrase: 水泳を習い始めてからというもの、冬でも風邪を引かなかった。
translations: Ever since I started learning how to swim, even in winter, I don't catch a cold.

meaning.meaning: Just as one is about to start doing something
meaning.example: Just as I was about to leave the house, it started raining

phrases.phrase: 私が返事をしようとした矢先に、彼が口を出してきた。
translations: I was about to reply, when he boldly cut in.

phrases.phrase: 父が出かけようとした矢先に電話が鳴った。
translations: My father was about to leave when the telephone rang.

meaning.example: There's no way to express my gratitude for your saving me

phrases.phrase: 良子さんの美しさと言ったらない。
translations: There's no way to express Yoshiko's beauty.

phrases.phrase: 今まで残業し続いたせいで、体の疲れ具合と言ったらない。
translations: I cannot describe my exhaustion after having worked so much overtime.

meaning.example: ～という程まで

phrases.phrase: お金を払ってまで見たい映画ではない。
translations: It's not a movie one wants to pay to see.

meaning.meaning: to avoid giving a direct answer
meaning.example: 本音を見せず、お茶を濁した。He beat around the bush and avoided showing his true feelings.//もちろん人それぞれだからと慌てて茶を濁し、話題をすり替えた。She hurriedly made up some excuse about there being all types of people and changed the subject.
without thinking, I shouted out

phrases.phrase: 電車の中でふと木村さんを見かけた
translations: By coincidence, I happened to see Kimura san on the train

phrases.phrase: ふと新しい考えが浮かんだ。
translations: Suddenly, I hit upon this new idea.

phrases.phrase: テレビを見ていて学生時代の友達をふと思い出した。
translations: Watching TV,I had this instant recall of the memory of my friend during my student days.

phrases.phrase: ふとした事が人生の分かれ目になることがある。
translations: A pure happenstance can be a die-casting event in your life.

phrases.phrase: うまい考えがふと浮かんだ。
translations: A happy idea came upon me.

meaning.example: try my utmost

phrases.phrase: この仕事だったらせいぜい三日もあればできる。
translations: If it's this type of work, it can be done in about three days at the outside.

phrases.phrase: この仕事の完成にせいぜい努力します。
translations: I will exert my best in finishing this work.

phrases.phrase: あの婦人はせいぜい40歳だ。
translations: The lady is forty years old at most.

phrases.phrase: ここから歩いてせいぜい10分のところです。
translations: It is no more than ten minutes' walk from here.

phrases.phrase: この時計はせいぜい10ドルだ。
translations: This watch costs ten dollar at most.

meaning.example: I never even imagined it

phrases.phrase: 想像だにしなかった
translations: I never even imagined it

phrases.phrase: 聞くだに恐ろしい
translations: Just hearing about it is dreadful

phrases.phrase: その質問はいまだに頭から離れない。
translations: That question still sticks me.

phrases.phrase: その州では未だに古い慣習が根強い、とその文化人類学者は言っている。
translations: The anthropologist says old customs still prevail in the province.

phrases.phrase: その母親は子供の死をいまだに嘆き悲しんでいた。
translations: The mother was still grieving over her child's death.

meaning.example: As soon as the President arrived

phrases.phrase: 社長が会議室に入ったがはやいか、早速会議が始まった。
translations: As soon as the company president entered the meeting room, the meeting started.

phrases.phrase: その力士はまわしを取るが早いか、相手を投げ飛ばした。
translations: As soon as the sumo wrestler snared the front of the opponent's sash, he tumbled him onto the ground.

phrases.phrase: 新刊を出版したのですが、出版するが早いか腹を立てた人から手紙が届き始めました。
translations: We put a new book out, but the second it was published we started to get letters from angry people.

phrases.phrase: ことによるとあの女は、私が太刀打ちを始めるが早いか、人の助けでも呼ぶために、藪をくぐって逃げたかもしれない。
translations: It's possible that as soon as I started the sword fight, that that woman ran slipped into the grove and ran to call for help.

phrases.phrase: 言うが早いかやってしまった。
translations: No sooner said than done.

meaning.meaning: In the face of, in defiance of, in spite of
meaning.example: 周囲の反対をものともせずに、二人は結婚した。

phrases.phrase: 周囲の反対をものともせずに、二人は結婚した。
translations: in defiance of everyone around them, the two of them got married.

phrases.phrase: 雪の深い道をものともせずそいつはひたすら車を駆った。
translations: Without heed to the road deeply covered with snow, he doggedly drove on.

phrases.phrase: 敵の攻撃を物ともせず部隊は突進した。
translations: Heedless of the enemy advance, the troops charged.

phrases.phrase: 寒さをものともせずに、彼は薄着で外出した
translations: Making nothing of the cold he went out in thin clothes.

phrases.phrase: 氷のような水をものともせずに彼は川へ飛びこんだ
translations: He jumped into the river in defiance of the icy water.

meaning.example: ~だからこそ（他の理由ではない）

phrases.phrase: 皆様の協力があればこそ無事故で完工できたことを感謝しております。
translations: I'm thankful to you all, it's particularly because of all of your support that we were able to complete construction without incident.

phrases.phrase: エア切れで２０メートルの深度からエアエンボにもかからず浮上できたのも、日頃の訓練あればこそでした。
translations: The fact that I could surface from the depth of 20 meters after running out of air without suffering air embolism could only be attributed to the constant training I went through.

phrases.phrase: 私にはその仕事がやさしいとわかった。前にもそんな仕事をしたことがあればこそだ。
translations: I found the work easy, especially since I had done that kind of work before.

phrases.phrase: あなたのためを思えばこそ、厳しくしているのだ。
translations: Because I am especially thinking about your wellbeing, I am strict.

phrases.phrase: 頭がよければこその悩みですね。
translations: Especially because she is smart, she worries about such things.

meaning.example: of course she got angry

phrases.phrase: この空模様では、どうも雨になりそうだ。
translations: With this kind of sky apparently it will rain

phrases.phrase: どうもうまくゆかない。
translations: Whatever I do, it doesn't end up well.

phrases.phrase: どうも済みません。
translations: I feel very bad about it.

phrases.phrase: どうもよくわからん。
translations: It's not very clear and I don't quite understand.

phrases.phrase: 「あの人たちは、またストをやるんだろうか」「どうもそうらしいね」
translations: "Will they go on strike again?" "I'm afraid so."

meaning.meaning: besides doing a main thing, one is also involved in another activities.
meaning.example: the king sat beside the queen

phrases.phrase: メアリーは読書をしており、１匹の猫がかたわらで眠っていた。
translations: Mary was reading, with a cat sleeping beside her.

phrases.phrase: 王妃は王のかたわらに立っていた。
translations: The queen stood beside the king.

phrases.phrase: 審判はコートのかたわらにある高い椅子に座る。
translations: The umpire sits in a high chair at the side of the court.

phrases.phrase: 私はスペイン語を習うかたわら、趣味でフラメンコを習うことにしました.
translations: As well as studying Spanish, I decided to study flamenco as a hobby.

phrases.phrase: 私の母は自分で編み物を習うかたわら、人にも教えている
translations: In addition to learning how to knit, my mother also teaches it .

meaning.example: natto is tasty, I realized

phrases.phrase: 納豆は美味しいと気が付いた。
translations: Natto is tasty I realized.

phrases.phrase: 気がついたら病院のベッドに横たわっていた。
translations: When I came to, I was lying down on a hospital bed.

phrases.phrase: 彼が好きになったのに気が付いた。
translations: I realized that I liked him

phrases.phrase: 公園のベンチにかばんを置き忘れたことに今気がついた。
translations: I just realized that I forgot my satchel in a bench of the park.

meaning.meaning: while doing something and taking advantage of that opportunity to do something else
meaning.example: getting one thing done while doing something else

phrases.phrase: 散歩がてら本屋に寄った。
translations: Since I took a walk. I stopped at a bookshop.

phrases.phrase: せっかく上京したのだから見物がてら、買い物でもしよう。
translations: Since I've come all the way to the capital, I might as well get some shopping done on top of sightseeing.

phrases.phrase: ドライブがてら駅に私を迎えにきてください。
translations: Since you go for a run in the car, coud you pick me up at the station?

phrases.phrase: 息抜きがてら同僚とチャットをする。
translations: Chat with a colleague on the internet for a change.

point: 極まりない/　極まる

meaning.example: 私は、彼の失礼きわまりない態度に我慢ならなかった。 I couldn't get used to his unlimited rudeness.

readings.reading: きわまりない/　きわまる

phrases.phrase: その机は、乱雑極まりない状態だ。
translations: The desk is in a state of total disorder.

phrases.phrase: 私は、彼の失礼きわまりない態度に我慢ならなかった。
translations: I couldn't get used to his unlimited rudeness.

phrases.phrase: こんな風は強い日に小型のボートで沖に出るなんて、危険極まりない。
translations: This type of wind, for example sailing offshore on a small boat in a hard day, is extremely dangerous.

meaning.example: At the very outside

phrases.phrase: この仕事だったらたかだか三日もあればできる。
translations: This work can be completed within about three days at the outside.

phrases.phrase: パーティーの出席者はたかだか20人だろう。
translations: No more than (At best, only) 20 people will come to the party.

phrases.phrase: たかだか五万円稼いだくらいでいばるな。
translations: Don't be cocky about making a mere 50,000 yen.

meaning.meaning: cannot exist, not possible, can't afford to
meaning.example: don't have the time to

phrases.phrase: お客様がそろそろお着きになって大変なので、のんびりお茶など飲んではいられない。
translations: Guests are arriving soon and we will be very busy, so we won't be able to have a quiet cup of tea.

phrases.phrase: 眩しいというのは目をあけていられないほど光が強い様子だ。
translations: Dazzling is the state when light is so hard that you almost can't keep the eyes open.

phrases.phrase: 出かけたとき、外にいられないくらい風がつきささった。
translations: When we went out, we almost couln't stand the bite of the wind.

meaning.example: from his point of view

phrases.phrase: メールを受け取った方からすると、何のわるぎもなくついうっかり転送してしまったということでも、発信者からすると自分が丹精こめて書いたものを、無断で第三者に転送されてしまったということにもなりかねません。
translations: As the person receiving the email he might casually forward the message with no ill intent but for the person who sent the email, put together with hard effort, to be sent on to a third party without notice could be unforgivable.

phrases.phrase: 知っている側からすると
translations: From the point of view of those who know ...

phrases.phrase: この見地からすると、君の言うことは正しい。
translations: From this point of view, you are right.

phrases.phrase: 空模様では、からすると、雨はしばらくは止まないだろう。
translations: From the look of the sky, I'm afraid the rain won't let up for a while.

phrases.phrase: 空模様からすると、今夜あたり雪になるかもしれない。
translations: From the look of the sky, it may begin to snow tonight.

meaning.meaning: at least, at most a small thing
meaning.example: at least I want to finish

phrases.phrase: せめてなべでもあれば、ご飯が炊けるんですが
translations: If we at least had a pot, we could cook rice

phrases.phrase: せめて両親には分かって貰いたいんですが
translations: At least I want to be understood by my parents

phrases.phrase: じゃ、せめてテーブルの準備でもしましょう。
translations: At least let me help with the table.

phrases.phrase: せめて後十分待ってくれませんか。
translations: Can't you wait just ten more minutes?

phrases.phrase: せめて謝ってくれてもいいのに。
translations: He might at least apologize.

meaning.example: so long as I am a woman

phrases.phrase: やると決めたからには最後までやれ
translations: So long as you commit yourself to do it, stick with it to the very end.

phrases.phrase: パリに行ったからには絶対エッフェル塔に昇りたい
translations: Seeing as I went (came) to Paris, I absolutely want to go up the Eiffel Tower.

phrases.phrase: 女として生まれたからには綺麗でいたい
translations: Since I was born as a woman, I want to be pretty.

phrases.phrase: 約束したからには、守っていただきます。守らなければ死んでもらいます。
translations: As/in that you have made a promise, please keep it. If you don't, die for me.

phrases.phrase: 試合に出るからには、勝ちたい。
translations: Since I am going for match, I would like to win.

phrases.phrase: 留学生にして日本に行った。
translations: Only as a student did I go to Japan.

phrases.phrase: ９０歳にして彼はいまだに驚くほど元気である。
translations: At the age of ninety he still has surprising vigour.

phrases.phrase: これは長年訓練を積んだ彼のような人にして初めてできる技だ。
translations: This is a skill that only a person with long-term training such as he can pull off.

phrases.phrase: かれはノーベル賞に値する研究を成し遂げた。これは、偉大な科学者にして初めてできることであろう。
translations: He worked hard to execute Nobel Prize level research. This was the something only a great scholar could achieve.
